name: Rita McGrath
background: Rita Gunther McGrath is a professor of management at Columbia Business School and a leading expert on strategy in uncertain environments. Ranked #1 in strategy by Thinkers50. Author of 'The End of Competitive Advantage' (2013), 'Seeing Around Corners' (2019), and 'Discovery-Driven Growth' (2009). Originated discovery-driven planning (HBR 1995). Focuses on transient competitive advantages, inflection points, and learning-based strategy.

principles.name: Arena-Based Strategy
principles.description: Dynamic competition in fluid 'arenas' rather than fixed industries; focus on capabilities for entry/exit.
principles.falsification: When arena-based strategy leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Discovery-Driven Growth
principles.description: Planning framework for high-uncertainty ventures: reverse-engineer assumptions into testable milestones, plan to learn rather than forecast precisely.
principles.falsification: When discovery-driven growth leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Seeing Around Corners
principles.description: Spot inflection points early via peripheral vision, weak signals, and systematic experimentation.
principles.falsification: When seeing around corners leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Transient Advantage
principles.description: Competitive edges are temporary; succeed by rapidly exploiting opportunities then exiting to the next arena.
principles.falsification: When transient advantage leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
